answers.answer: I am also about 50 pounds over weight and had a m/c on 7/3 and I am currently 10 weeks pregnant and so far so good.  I think I just have to watch closer then others and would have rather lost the weight first this and the other pregnancy was not planned.  Now I am just going to have more to lose and a harder time but we will see my midwife doesn't seem to concerned about my weight.
Also I have a friend who was overweight around 50-60pounds and she has a healthy little girl.  You just have to watch it.  Good luck!

I don't think you can blame being overweight on losing a child.  I am a big person.  I was small when I got pregnant with my 1st but gained over 100 pounds during my pregnancy (yes young and naive).  I never lost that weight, so when I got pregnant with my 2nd child I was about 80 pounds overweight.  Well, I lost a little, so with my third I was only about 60 pounds overweight.  But, guess what, when I got pregnant with my 4th, I was about 130 lbs overweight, and now with my 5th, still about 130 lbs overweight.  Now, I did have two miscarriages between my 3rd and 4th, but the doctor NEVER contributed it to my weight, I was put back on thyroid medicine, that is what they thought had caused it and I easily got pregnant again and went on to have a healthy pregnancy.  So.....I am a sucess story and wish you the best of luck!

oh heck girl! i'm way more than 50lbs overweight. it took a bit to get pregnant and i got gestational diabetes carrying him, but i had a happy healthy 9lb baby boy. you'll be ok. I mean, it's obviously best to lose weight if you're overweight, but it's not critical in carrying a healthy baby to term. hang in there.

Let me just say i am very overweight and i have had no problems concieving. I got pregnant with my three year old son six months off bc. I am now 29 wks pregnant with number 2. The first time i tried to get pregnant it wasn't really that hard. Second time we weren't even trying. I think it really depends on your body, but especially in today's society there are alot of obese people out there who still reproduce. I also have a friend who is overweight and got pregnant on the first try. Keep your head up I think  you'll be just fine. It would probly help you chances to lose weight but i wouldn't say it's the determining factor of not becoming pregnant.

Women with PCOS are often overweight and in those cases, ttc can be difficult. If you're ovulation then you can become pregnant. I am about 40-50 and conceived either 1st or 2nd month trying 3 times. 2nd PG ended in m/c though :(Of course it's best to get down to an ideal weight prior to conceiving to limit complications when pregnant like GD, higher risk of c-section, etc.Lots of baby dust to you*************

Hello i was overweight when we were trying for #2 and it took us almost two years to get pregnant and for it to stick. We had one m/c at 5 weeks and after that the tested me progesterone and it was low, I dont know if that had to do wiht my weight ( in my mind it did) but why i got preg with my now 1 year old son I had to take suppliments. But if it is ment to happen then it will i am sorry for your loss but Super Sticky Baby Dust.!!!
my partner is about 5'-4" and weighed 230 both times she got pregnant. it took some doing (clomid, HcG, etc.) but she had very easy pregnancies.
im over weight and got preggo the first time we tried and now have a happy fealthy 4 1/2 month old dd.  hang in there!

I was 40lbs overweight when I started out (I am only 5ft so that makes me obese(nasty word!)). I am 35 weeks now and the pregnancy has been a dream, I have gained about 20lbs, but no diabetes or anything, not even a stretch mark. I am just starting to feel like I am about to pop though and have had a bit of swelling in the last week. I already have one child who was born 8 weeks early but that was nothing to do with my weight and although I weighed less when I started that one it was much worse than this, I had back problems, severe heartburn that I needed medicating for and got loads of stretch marks. Every pregnancy is different and it I think the most important thing is being healthy and active during the pregnancy regardless of what your starting weight is.
I just sent you an email. :)

question: I need to lose about 50 lbs....but I got pregnant immediately this summer, but miscarried.I just wondered if there were other plus-sized women here who have had healthy babies and such.I'm just feeeling down....like my baby died because i was too fat.  :(What do you think>
title: Who's significantly overweight and pregnant?  Success stories?
